subject: Re: [junit] assertTrue(true)
msgSnippet: ... Most (not all) of the time I put in a test for the exception message. At least: assertNotNull(ex.getMessage()); If I m feeling energetic I may even try
messageBody:
haefeleuser wrote:

> What do you prefer in the case above: assertTrue(true) or inline
> comment in the catch block?

Most (not all) of the time I put in a test for the exception message. At
least:

assertNotNull(ex.getMessage());

If I'm feeling energetic I may even try something like

assertEquals(ex.getMessage(), expectedMessage);

If the exception class provides more data than just the message I can
check that instead.

Like most other tests, this seems completely pointless until the first
time it finds a bug you didn't know you had.

--
